eu_initiatives: Veterinary medicines for use in livestock, antimicrobial resistance and medicated feed legislation
organisation_name: Responsible Use of Medicines in Agriculture (RUMA)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: RUMA is a member of the European equivalent organisation EPRUMA - European Platform for the Responsible Use of Medicines in Animals
relevant_communication: All RUMA activities including press releases are set out in www.ruma.org.uk.  Main work is representing the livestock sectors of the UK prmoting the responsible use of medicines, which involved producing guidelines on responsible use of antimicrobials for farmers and vets which are available free on the website. In 2017 we launched a new website to provide information on antibiotic use in farming www.farmantibiotics.org.
legal_status: Private company limited by guarantee under the Companies Act 2006
goals__remit: RUMA is a unique, independent non-profit group involving organisations representing all stages of the animal food chain from ‘farm to fork’ that have an interest in the stewardship of animal medicines in agriculture. This reflects the importance of traceability, transparency and accountability at all points in the chain: from primary food production, through processing, manufacturing and retailing to the final consumer.
